event.name: Labor Day Party
event.description: Labor Day end of summer celebration
foodTips: Last cookout of summer - make it count with premium BBQ.
Weather can be unpredictable - have an indoor backup plan for food.
Pool parties need poolside snacks that won't blow away.
Kids go back to school soon - family-friendly food is key.
Leftovers are expected - plan portions with next-day sandwiches in mind.
event.foodBuyingGuide: Similar to 4th of July but slightly more relaxed. BBQ, grilled foods, and summer salads are perfect. This is often the last outdoor party of the year, so people tend to indulge a bit more.
proTips: End of summer means people are ready to indulge one last time.
Weather can vary - have backup plans for rain.
Pool parties need drinks near the pool AND inside.
It's often slightly cooler than July - ice lasts longer.
Monday holiday means people may drink a bit more than usual.
event.buyingGuide: Similar to 4th of July but slightly higher consumption as people celebrate the end of summer. Plan 5-6 drinks per person with heavy beer emphasis.

meta.title: How Much Tacos for 250 Guests Labor Day Party? | 64 dozen
meta.description: Need tacos for a 250-person labor day party? You'll need exactly 64 dozen. Free calculator with pro tips for party planning.
meta.h1: How Much Tacos for a 250 Guests Labor Day Party?

mathExplanation.label: Estimate actual eaters
mathExplanation.explanation: At xlarge events, about 80% of guests will eat full servings.

mathExplanation.label: Calculate servings (as main dish)
mathExplanation.explanation: As a main dish, plan for 3 tacos per person.

mathExplanation.label: Apply labor day party modifier
mathExplanation.explanation: Labor Day Partys typically consume 10% more tacos than average.

mathExplanation.label: Add 15% buffer & round up
mathExplanation.explanation: Always round up and add a buffer. Running out of food is worse than having leftovers!
